revised_title: Inhibition of Memory Formation in Chickens: Long-term Memory and Drug Effects
tldr: This study investigates the effects of drug inhibition on memory formation in chickens, specifically focusing on long-term memory. Researchers found that inhibitors of the sodium pump can block memory formation only if present during the learning process, while inhibitors of protein synthesis can prevent long-term memory formation even when administered after learning. These findings suggest that there are at least two stages in memory formation: a short-term phase dependent on membrane mechanisms and a permanent storage phase dependent on protein synthesis.
